portrait.name: Nick Fewings
portrait.description: One of my favourite subjects is street art and recently, I had the opportunity to undertake some team-building with a client in Weston-Super-Mare, UK.  Weston was the location for Banksy’s creation called Dismaland, which caused quite a stir.  On one of the local pubs, I noticed this artwork, that whilst not by Banksy, bears a striking resemblance.  I love the juxtaposition of the love heart balloons and the sinister look of the girl sat on the swing.

portrait.name: Dakota Corbin
portrait.description: Fun street art in downtown Provo, UT.

portrait.name: Nick Fewings
portrait.description: On holiday in Florence (Firenze), Tuscany, Italy, where there was a lot of street art and graffiti, however most of it was extremely good, including this simple one that, to me, tells a powerful and strong story.

portrait.name: Zuza Gałczyńska
portrait.description: You are coming back from university. As usual, you missed a bus. You walk through the center. In your ears you hear your favorite song and see how the city wakes up from lethargy.

portrait.name: Autumn Studio
portrait.description: We were roaming the streets of Singapore’s Chinatown with no particular destination or agenda in mind. Turning into an alley along Keong Saik Road, we saw this vibrant mural and couldn’t resist snapping a picture. Created by Singapore artists who go by the moniker ‘Ripple Root’, this wall is so vibrant and definitely adds to the area’s buzzing good vibes.

portrait.name: Marian Kroell
portrait.description: One day, as I was cycling along the promenade of Ponta Delgada, I came across this colourful house that I had to capture.

portrait.name: Mercedes Álvarez
portrait.description: We took this amazing vacation with friends, just walking all around NY city, discovering the amazing streets and its colors and secrets, and all the beautiful things you just stumble upon when you get lost in the little streets and have your faithful camera handy. I just love this shot, it’s the first one I downloaded from my camera and straight to LR to export, the colors, the angle, the shadows, the little door.. it just fits, and Audrey makes it perfect. Amazing artist, thank you for the inspiration!

portrait.name: E. C. Crippen
portrait.description: I captured this shot while walking around Wynnwood arts district during Art Basel. Wynnwood is magical and inspiring!

portrait.name: George Pagan III
portrait.description: A mural of only three words repeated over and over again with white sharpie markers

portrait.name: Marion Michele
portrait.description: New wall found in Manhattan Beach, CA!

landscape.name: Mercedes Álvarez
landscape.description: Still walking, still wondering around New York’s streets in the sunny cold-cold weather, when I suddenly turn my eyes up and I get the sun in my eyes and I see this incredible graffiti just made to perfection staring at me, I just loved it. Popping out in between the buildings with this perfect Crying Girl looking right to me. Beautiful, thanks to the perfect artist who made it!

landscape.name: Marion Michele
landscape.description: Found this street art in Venice, CA.

landscape.name: Camille Orgel
landscape.description: You Are Going To Be Fine

landscape.name: Nick Fewings
landscape.description: There is a lot of street art that has sprung up in and around Bournemouth, in preparation for the Summer and the tourists.  This wonderful ice cream was painted on the side of the pier.

landscape.name: Charlie Solorzano
landscape.description: Yellow Submarine Graffitti

landscape.name: Alice Donovan Rouse
landscape.description: I stumbled across this mural on our last day in Amsterdam. We aren’t often ones to take formal tours so we end up wandering through the streets of new places and more often than not we get lost. Finding hidden gems like these among alleyways please me more than waiting in line for tours of old mansions. You can find this piece at Frans Halsstraat 64, 1072BT, Amsterdam.

landscape.name: Wyron A
landscape.description: Horizon Avenue

landscape.name: "My Life Through A Lens"
landscape.description: “Together, we create!” on brick wall

landscape.description: one of a series of Garage doors in a laneway in Stanmore, NSW

landscape.description: Storm trooper street art

landscape.description: On the way to Waimea Canyon in Kauai

landscape.name: Henry Mwenge
landscape.description: We were trying to catch this street art and just as we were about to, a couple walked round the corner and we thought we could capture them before and after they crossed the ‘battlefield’. Worked a treat.

landscape.name: Paul Murphy
landscape.description: I happened to take this on my way to the Post Office in Belfast and decided to take the underpass for safety.  I just loved the feel of it and the guy walking added to the atmosphere.The colours really popped when I ran it through Lightroom - HOWEVER this pic was taken with my trusty old iPhone 6 Plus and despite having full frame Nikon cameras and great glass at my disposal this phone still astounds me with the onboard camera.  They say the best camera is the one you have with you and the 6 plus is always with me.
